meanings.sent1: The company offered a concessional deal to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: The negotiators reached a concessional agreement after hours of discussion.
meanings.sent3: The concessional offer was so good that everyone wanted to take advantage of it.
meanings.sent4: Her concessional attitude towards compromise helped resolve the conflict.
meanings.sent5: The concessional terms made the contract very appealing to potential investors.

meanings.definition: Providing or involving concessions, especially in terms of financial benefits or terms.
meanings.sent1: The bank provided concessional loans to help small businesses grow.
meanings.sent2: The concessional package included discounts and flexible payment options.
meanings.sent3: He was thrilled to receive the concessional offer and save money on his purchase.
meanings.sent4: Her concessional approach to budgeting allowed her to save more each month.
meanings.sent5: The concessional benefits of the job made it an attractive opportunity for many.

meanings.definition: Granted or obtained through a concession.
meanings.sent1: The concessional permit allowed them to access the restricted area.
meanings.sent2: She received a concessional scholarship for her academic achievements.
meanings.sent3: The concessional pass made their visit to the theme park much more affordable.
meanings.sent4: His concessional ticket to the event was a pleasant surprise.
meanings.sent5: The concessional approval came as a relief after weeks of waiting.
